intro: Vernonia rojasii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its foliage is narrow and linear, with gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss in arid environments. Vernonia rojasii produces small, pale yellow to brown flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
